metadata.title: CVE-2022-20369 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In v4l2_m2m_querybuf of v4l2-mem2mem.c, there is a possible out of boundswrite due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalationof privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction isnot needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroidID: A-223375145References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
